spec.name: Statue 16th November
spec.description: The Statue (or Monument) of 16th November is a significant piece of public art and a national landmark located in the city center. It commemorates **November 16, 1955**, the date that King Mohammed V returned from exile, marking a crucial step towards Moroccan independence. The sculpture was designed by architect **Abdelhaq Sijelmassi** and completed in 1982. It stands as a symbolic reminder of national pride and the struggle for sovereignty.

people.comment: Architect and designer of the monumental sculpture.
